snippet: A counting error may have put Mr. Romney's narrow victory in the Iowa caucuses in doubt, but he benefited from wearing the crown. He gained the right to be called a winner, and more importantly, not a loser.
abstract: A counting error may have put Mr. Romney's narrow victory in the Iowa caucuses in doubt, but he benefited from wearing the crown. He gained the right to be called a winner, and more importantly, not a loser.
lead_paragraph: Our colleague Nate Silver reported that Mitt Romney may not have actually won the Iowa caucuses because of a mix-up in counting, which seems like no big deal because it will have little practical effect on the race for delegates to secure the nomination.

headline.main: What Did Romney Win in Iowa? The Right to Be Called 'Winner'
